hero.content:
The Filipino islanders who weave their dreams
bbc.com

For more than 300 years, women residing around a turquoise lake have woven textiles from visions they say were bestowed to them by a goddess in their dreams.
bbc.com

primary.lead: the Warm Weather Effects of El Niño
primary.title: El Niño could bring prolonged dry spell
primary.description: The El Niño weather episode could bring a long dry spell and even droughts to the country, the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (Pagasa) has predicted.

secondary.title: Bare plan vs El Niño, Sen. Nancy Binay urges gov’t
secondary.description: Manila, Philippines — With the El Niño phenomenon now under way, the government must lay down a “comprehensive” approach in addressing another possible water shortage in the country, Sen.

secondary.title: Marcos: Government addressing water woes
secondary.description: The administration is addressing the water crisis, President Marcos said yesterday as he reiterated the need to improve the way the country manages the resource.

secondary.title: Maynilad: Brace for longer daily water interruptions next week - Manila Standard
secondary.description: Maynilad on Wednesday said it has begun daily service interruptions to preserve the remaining supply of water in the Angat-Ipo system, as there will be less rainfall to replenish the dams because of the El Niño.

carousel.title: From living water to toxic sludge: the Philippine island devastated by an oil spill – a photo essay
carousel.description: For Mindoro islanders, the slick from sunken tanker Princess Empress has harmed livelihoods, caused health problems and done untold damage to marine life. Can the island recover?

carousel.title: A 106-year-old from the Philippines is Vogue's oldest ever cover model
carousel.description: Vogue Philippines has revealed Apo Whang-Od as the cover star of its April issue, a move that makes the 106-year-old tattoo artist from the Philippines the oldest person ever to appear on the front of Vogue.

carousel.title: Dissecting ‘merienda culture’ in the city
carousel.description: While merienda may have shifted from its history over the years, it remains one of our local food traditions that continue to endure

carousel.title: Miami Heat's Erik Spoelstra Explains The Love For Basketball In The Philippines
carousel.description: Miami Heat coach Erik Spoelstra recently spoke his basketball experiences in The Philippines
